channel.title: Last minute suggestions?
channel.description:
Hey guys. Recently, my computer exploded (quite literally, in fact) so I needed a new computer :b
I've pretty much got all my parts down, which is going to come out to about 900 bucks (Which is quite a steal, for what i'm getting)
I just wanted to see if you guys see any problems with what i'm buying, whether it be compatibility issues, personal opinion on the parts, or even suggestions as to what i should buy instead. Feedback is a must guys.
Here are the parts
Motherboard GIGABYTE GA-890GPA-UD3H AM3 AMD 890GX HDMI SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 ATX AMD Motherboard (130$)
CPU AMD Phenom II X4 965 Black Edition Deneb 3.4GHz 4 x 512KB L2 Cache 6MB L3 Cache Socket AM3 125W Quad-Core Processor HDZ965FBGMBOX (140$)
RAM
CORSAIR Vengeance 6GB (3 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1600 Desktop Memory Model CMZ6GX3M3A1600C9 (77$)
Video Card
XFX HD-687A-ZDFC Radeon HD 6870 1GB 256-bit GDDR5 PCI Express 2.1 x16 HDCP Ready CrossFireX Support Video Card with Eyefinity (209$)
Sound Card
Creative SB X-Fi Xtreme Audio 70SB104000000 7.1 Channels PCI Express x1 Interface Sound Card (44$)
DVD Burner
LG Black 10X BD-ROM 16X DVD-ROM 48X CD-ROM SATA Internal Blu-ray Drive Model UH12LS28 OEM LightScribe Support - OEM (60$)
Case COOLER MASTER Storm Scout SGC-2000-KKN1-GP Black Steel / Plastic ATX Mid Tower Computer Case (89$)
Power Supply hec X-Power Pro 650 650W Continuous @ 40°C ATX 12V v2.2 / EPS 12V SLI Ready CrossFire Ready Power Supply (60$)
Heat Sink XIGMATEK Intel Core i7 compatible Dark Knight-S1283V REV.W with ACK-I5361 120mm Long Life Bearing CPU Cooler I7 i5 775 1155 and AMD compatible (40$)
Theres no hard drive because i have an external 2tb that im going to strip open and put right in.
tl;dr Rate the parts i'm buying, and give suggestions to improvement.
EDIT: if you have suggestions as to different parts to buy, giving me the priice on newegg (US version) is preffered, because thats where im buying everything.

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: TheKeeper
item.description:
lol! Intel vs Amd boners. Personally I have an old Phenom 940 black edition, and considering that Amd are usually cheaper it was a good buy. Also, I’m sure we can throw figures around, about which have the most cache or which runs hotter etc… Even with my old phenom I can run everything that’s gonna come out for the next year. The Crysis days are over my friends. Pc will now follow xbox lead graphx. As for your parts, I’d say build that sucka!

Furthermore, screw reviews! After Intel settled their lawsuit with Amd for muscling board vendors I wouldn’t place a lot of trust in what your local compu store guy or the interwebs is telling you. Its a conspiracy.

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Maverix26:

The phenom runs at 3.4, and can OC to about 3.7-3.8 (Which is why im buying the heatsink) Plus it’s a quad core, making the only real measurable difference being the 8 mb l3 cache vs the amd’s 6 mb cache

How can’t it almost get the same done??

edit: And wait, the phenom’s got a 4 x 512 kb l2 cache, with the i7 2600k running 4 x 256 l2 cache… so i’m kinda not getting how they’re not super closely matched, if not the same o.o

I feel like someones gonna call me stupid on this :b

https://www.hardwaresecrets.com/article/Core-i5-2500K-vs-Phenom-II-X4-975-BE-CPU-Review/1163/16

https://www.anandtech.com/bench/Product/288?vs=102

Also, if you talk about OC, the 2500k can’t be beaten by any amd processor.

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: JayJay
item.description:
Definitely a more powerful PSU, but other than that looks good I don’t personally have much experience with AMD (last one I had was a K7/Athlon, since then its been Intel ) so I can’t really comment on that, but I can say that XFX is a good graphics card brand to go for, I’ve always bought my cards from them (they’ve always been GeForce chipsets though not ATI, but still, good company).

I stick to Intel and GeForce and I’ve never had any problems

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Kumo
item.description:
You might need a more powerful power supply by about another 100w, but other than that looks decent.

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
hmm, i tihnk i’m, gonna stick with raedon, only because it’s a tiny bit cheaper, and a friend of mine has one that hasn’t let him down.
The warranty is great, but i know people who can fix/replace parts for a good price, thanks anyway though(:

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: jindafrom
item.description:
The EVGA Geforce 470 is a bit more expensive than the Radeon HD 6870 1GB, but comes with lifetime warranty, just in case, you know, your computer explodes.

As you may know already, the 2 cards are highly similar in performance.

Read full topic

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
acade366:

no

The phenom runs at 3.4, and can OC to about 3.7-3.8 (Which is why im buying the heatsink) Plus it’s a quad core, making the only real measurable difference being the 8 mb l3 cache vs the amd’s 6 mb cache

How can’t it almost get the same done??

edit: And wait, the phenom’s got a 4 x 512 kb l2 cache, with the i7 2600k running 4 x 256 l2 cache… so i’m kinda not getting how they’re not super closely matched, if not the same o.o

I feel like someones gonna call me stupid on this :b

Read full topic

The phenom i posted will get almost the same done

no

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
Yea, i heard about that, but I really need a computer, and if anything, i’ll sell the cpu and buy a new one i guess?

So other than that, the parts are good, yes?

item.title: Last minute suggestions?
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
The only thing I can say is its a bit of shitty time to buy a new pc atm as the new amd cpu’s are out soon and with that intel will drop prices/bring out new cpu’s. The 2600K’s are cheap over here, wish I waited and got one of these.

But if you have no pc then what can you do…

Read full topic

item.description:
